meanings.sent1: He prenticed under a skilled carpenter to learn the trade.
meanings.sent2: She was prenticed to a blacksmith to learn the art of forging.
meanings.sent3: The young boy prenticed with a baker, but his bread always turned out burnt.
meanings.sent4: She prenticed with a famous artist, soaking up creativity like a sponge.
meanings.sent5: The eager student prenticed diligently, eager to absorb knowledge and skills.

meanings.definition: To be bound by indentures to serve an apprenticeship.
meanings.sent1: He was prenticed to the master craftsman for five years.
meanings.sent2: She prenticed with the tailor, learning the trade through hard work.
meanings.sent3: The young apprentice was prenticed to the grumpy old shoemaker.
meanings.sent4: She felt prenticed to her duties, like a bird in a gilded cage.
meanings.sent5: The young man prenticed himself to the wise old wizard, eager to learn magic.
